alert.note: Alert for Sheridan (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 05 at 3:40PM MDT until further notice by NWS Billings
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 930 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of north central Wyoming, including the following county, Sheridan. * WHEN...Until 930 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Rises in small streams and normally dry arroyos. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 334 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms up in the Bighorn Mountains. This will cause small stream flooding downstream as water will rapidly flow down the mountains. Between 1 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following streams and drainages... The Big and Little Goose Creeks, Little Tongue River, and their associated tributaries. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 2 inches are expected over the Bighorn Mountains. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Sheridan, Ranchester, Dayton and Big Horn. - Outdoor recreationists in the mountains will be impacted, as that is where the heavy rain is occurring at. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Do not drive on or attempt to cross flooded roads, find an alternate route. Roads and driveways may be damaged or washed out in places. Please report observed flooding to local emergency officials and request they pass the information to the National Weather Service in Billings.
